title: Vincent Goossaert and David A. Palmer, “The Religious Question in Modern China” University of Chicago Press, 2011
description:
Social phenomena that some people like to call ‘religion’ has long shaped Chinese culture. In the twentieth century, defining the boundaries of what constitutes ‘religion’ has been central to the construction of a modern nation.
